CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. 1, reads: "Accident or Bigotry? - Alonzo R. Sanders, World War II veteran, of 52 Shannon Ave., Washington, Pa., believes his new $13,000 home, which was being built on Christy Rd., Eighty-four, Pa., was burned down to its foundation last week by a person or persons who objected to Negroes living in that area. Police and firemen reported they found no evidence of arson. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Concrete block foundation of Alonzo R. Sanders' home, surrounded by trees and construction debris, Eighty Four, Pennsylvania
CatSubject_tab: Buildings--Pennsylvania--Eighty Four.Construction and demolition debris--Pennsylvania--Eighty Four.Construction--Pennsylvania--Eighty Four.
